description:
Development of site to provide 19 sheltered flats; 9
sheltered houses; a warden's flat - office and guest
room; conversion of part of south wing of priory to
provide 15 sheltered flats  common room and including
provision of associated access  parking  landscaping
gardens and refuse point as shown on drawing no`s
8714/P01A P02A P03A P04A P05A P06A P07A P08A P09A P10A
P11E P12B P12C P13A P14A P15A P16 and as revised on the
30th March 1988.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted must be begun not later
    than the expiration of five years from the date of this
    permission.

Condition : 2 - The details of the elevations and facing materials to be
    used on the building shall not be otherwise than as shall
    have been submitted to and approved by the Council before
    any work on the site is commenced and including design of
    doors and fenestration.(elevations,facing materials)

Condition : 3 - All new work and work of making good shall be carried out
    to match the original work as closely as possible in
    materials and detailed execution.

Condition : 4 - The whole of the car parking accommodation shown on the
    drawings shall be provided and retained permanently for the
    parking of vehicles of the occupiers and users of the
    remainder of the building.

Condition : 5 - Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and
    Country Planning General Development Order 1977 (as
    amended) or any Order revoking and re-enacting that Order,
    no development within Classes I and II of Schedule I of
    that Order shall be carried out without the grant of
    planning permission having first been obtained from the
    Council.

Condition : 6 - No development shall take place until full details of hard
    and soft landscaping and means of enclosure of all unbuilt,
    open areas have been submitted to and approved by the
    Council.

Condition : 7 - All hard and soft landscaping works shall be carried out to
    later than the end of the following planting season, with
    others of similar size and species, unless the Council
    gives written consent to any variation.
    a reasonable standard in accordance with the approved
    landscape details by not later than the end of the planting
    season following completion of the development or any phase
    of the development, whichever is the sooner. Any trees or
    areas of planting which, within a period of 5 years from
    the completion of the development, die, are removed, or
    become seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced as
    soon as is reasonably possible and, in any case, by not

Condition : 8 - The Priory garden shall be retained for the sole use of
    residents of the development hereby approved.

Condition : 9 - The residentail dwellings hereby approved shall be used
    only for sheltered housing for the elderly and for no other
    purpose.

Condition : 10 - In order that the Council may give consideration to the
    details of the proposed development.

Condition : 11 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building.

Condition : 12 - In order to safeguard the special architectural and
    historic interest of the building.

Condition : 13 - To ensure the permanent retention of the accommodation for
    parking purposes and to ensure that the use of the building
    does not add to traffic congestion.

Condition : 14 - To safeguard the visual amenities of the area and to
    prevent over-development of the site by controlling
    proposed extensions and alterations.

Condition : 15 - In order that the Council may give consideration to the
    details of the proposed development.

Condition : 16 - To ensure that the landscaping is carried out within a
    reasonable period and to maintain a satisfactory standard
    of visual amenity in the scheme.

Condition : 17 - So that the residents may enjoy a reasonable standard of
    amenity space.

Condition : 18 - To ensure that the accommodation is used in accordance with
    the intentions of the proposed scheme and is not used for
    unauthorised purposes.

Condition : 19 - Works of construction and ancillary activity should not
    take place other than between the hours of 8am to 6pm on
    Monday to Friday and 8am to 1pm on Saturday, with no
    working on Sunday or Bank Holidays, in order to comply with
    locally enforced standards.
